explanation.rules:
The possessive phrase follows this pattern: possessed_a-sfx_a-POSS_b possessor_b-sfx_b

Masculine (m)
    Animals: lion, leopard, flamingo.
    Objects, body parts: long/thin.
Suffixes:
    Singular:
        Noun suffix (sfx): -ø (none).
        Possessive marker (POSS): -ma.
    Plural:
        Noun suffix (sfx): -bii*.
        Possessive marker (POSS): -itcha*.

Feminine (f)
    Animals: zebra, impala, elephant, baboon, giraffe.
    Objects, body parts: short/thick.
Suffixes:
    Singular:
        Noun suffix (sfx): -ko.
        Possessive marker (POSS): -sa.
    Plural:
        Noun suffix (sfx): -bee.
        Possessive marker (POSS): -eta.

Vowel change for masculine plural endings:
    Stem vowels e and o change to i and u respectively before a masculine plural ending is added.
    This change is blocked by an intervening a. For example, in zzokwana-bii.
Suffix Combination:
    The sequence of suffixes -bii-itcha becomes -biitcha.
